page.title: 07PLASHETT _ RECREATION
page.content: There is evidence that some of the woodland is used for shooting, a Game Keeper is employed to maintain it. In the summer months small areas are made available for camping and caravaning, near farms or public houses which provide water and toilet facilities. The reservoir at Barcombe is available for fishing and the River Ouse at Barcombe Mills is used for boating by both the public and organisations such as the Guides and Scouts. Lawn Mower races, a recent innovation, are held at the 'Half_way House' at Rose Hill. Bed and breakfast accomodation is available at the 'Chapelfield Motel' and riding stables are maintained near the 'Old Ship'.
